data.title: Nick Zano's Dating and Relationship History
data.meta_description: Who is Nick Zano dating? Many famous women have dated Legends of Tomorrow star Nick Zano, and this list will give you more details about these lucky ladies.
data.text:
Who is Nick Zano dating? Many famous women have dated Legends of Tomorrow star Nick Zano, and this list will give you more details about these lucky ladies. Including Nick Zano’s current girlfriend, past relationships, pictures together, and dating rumors, this comprehensive dating history tells you everything you need to know about Nick Zano’s love life.

This list features Nick Zano’s ex-girlfriends along with additional information about them, such as when they were born and what they do professionally. These ladies come in all shapes and sizes, but what they all have in common is that they're all women that Nick Zano has either dated or hooked up with. It's not hard to get jealous of these women that Nick Zano has gone out with, so try your hardest to contain your envy.

This list of Nick Zano’s girlfriends and rumored exes includes Amanda Bynes, Kat Dennings, Haylie Duff, and Leah Renee Cudmore, with whom he has a son.

Leah Renee Cudmore and Nick Zano started dating in July 2014.

They have a son, born in 2016.

Age : 38

Birthplace : Toronto, Ontario, Canada

2 Broke Girls costars Nick Zano and Kat Dennings dated from December 2011 to June 2014.

After meeting on the set of My Sexiest Year in 2007, Nick Zano and Haylie Duff dated from January 2008 to November 2011.

Haylie Duff, an American actress, singer, songwriter, producer, and author, was born on February 19, 1985, in Houston, Texas. She is the older sister of fellow actress and singer Hilary Duff. Haylie's journey towards stardom commenced with ballet at a young age, leading her to perform in productions of The Nutcracker Suite with the Houston Metropolitan Dance Company. Her evolution in the entertainment industry began with acting roles in both television and film, including her breakout role as Summer Wheatley in Napoleon Dynamite. Duff's career expanded into music when she joined her sister for a cover of "Our Lips Are Sealed" for the soundtrack of A Cinderella Story, which led to further collaborations. It was this foray into music that saw the Duff sisters embark on a national concert tour. However, Haylie also proved successful as a solo act with her composition "Sweetest Pain," featured on the soundtrack of Raising Helen. Beyond acting and music, Haylie demonstrated her versatility by venturing into the world of authorship and cooking. In 2013, she launched The Real Girl's Kitchen, a blog that morphed into a book and eventually a television series, thus showcasing her culinary skills to the world. Equally influential behind the scenes, Duff has added production to her repertoire, having served as an executive producer for several films and television series. Through an impressive, multifaceted career, Haylie Duff continues to make remarkable strides, leaving an indelible mark on the entertainment industry.

Age : 39

Birthplace : Houston, Texas, USA

Kristin Cavallari and Nick Zano dated from September 2006 to December 2007.

Kristin Cavallari, an accomplished television personality and entrepreneur, has made a significant mark in the world of entertainment and business. Born on January 5, 1987, in Denver, Colorado, she rose to fame with her appearance on the reality TV show Laguna Beach: The Real Orange County. This was followed by its successful spin-off, The Hills, where she further solidified her status as a prominent figure in reality television. Cavallari is also a successful entrepreneur with her own lifestyle brand, Uncommon James. Launched in 2017, the brand offers jewelry, apparel, and home goods and has been widely recognized for its chic, minimalist aesthetics. This venture showcases her prowess in the business world, proving she is more than just a reality TV star. Kristin's life journey also includes authoring several books. Her first book, Balancing in Heels: My Journey to Health, Happiness, and Making It All Work, was published in 2016, providing insightful advice on health, family, and fashion. Two years later, she penned the cookbook True Roots, sharing over 100 gluten-free, dairy-free, and refined sugar-free recipes. These books reveal a new dimension of Cavallari, showcasing her passion for wellness and healthy living. Throughout her career, she has managed to balance her roles as a successful actress, entrepreneur, and author.

Age : 37

Birthplace : Denver, Colorado, USA

Rachel Perry and Nick Zano dated from May 2005 to August 2006.

Rachel Perry (born January 20, 1976) is a Canadian- born TV personality working in the United States. The former MuchMusic VJ is the host of All Access on VH1, and is the narrator for Web Junk 20, and the host of "The Stash" on Playboy TV. Born in Brockville, Ontario, Perry has done numerous narrations and voiceovers for VH1 shows, specials and Viacom channels specials, including Viacom owned gay and lesbian station Logo. She was also the co-host of VH1's reality show Strip Search which lasted for one season. She was co-host of Pepsi Smash. Perry began working at VH1 in January 2001 where she hosted VH1 News, All Access and the morning video show. In June 2001, she hosted Not Much On Day, a MuchMusic marathon of music videos which featured pop stars wearing little or no clothing. Perry appeared naked throughout the marathon with various objects covering her body. Until March 2006, she was also the host of VH1's Top 20 Countdown. She sometimes co-hosted with fellow Canadians Aamer Haleem and Bradford How. She narrated the behind the scenes program for Brokeback Mountain, which is featured on the DVD for it.

Age : 48

Birthplace : Brockville, Canada

What I Like About You costars Nick Zano and Amanda Bynes dated from April 2003 to August 2004.

Amanda Bynes, a multi-talented American actress, rose to prominence in the 1990s and early 2000s. Born on April 3, 1986, in Thousand Oaks, California, Bynes displayed an affinity for performing arts from a young age. Her parents encouraged her passion, allowing her to attend the Laugh Factory Comedy Camp at the age of 10. This opportunity paved the way for her successful career in television and film. Bynes first captured the hearts of audiences as a child star on Nickelodeon's All That, and later, she further cemented her comedic prowess with her own program, The Amanda Show. Her impeccable comic timing and quirky characters made her a household name among young viewers. Bynes's transition to the big screen was marked by her role in the film Big Fat Liar, followed by leading roles in popular teen movies such as What a Girl Wants, She's the Man, and Hairspray. With each performance, Bynes showcased her versatility as an actress, effortlessly oscillating between comedy and drama. However, Bynes's life off-screen has been marked by personal challenges and legal troubles. After announcing an abrupt retirement from acting in 2010, she faced a series of run-ins with the law. She also publicly grappled with mental health issues, undergoing psychiatric treatment. Despite these difficulties, Bynes has repeatedly demonstrated resilience, pursuing studies in fashion design and continually striving to rebuild her life.

Age : 38

Birthplace : Thousand Oaks, California, USA
